title.text: Example-based machine translation using DP-matching between word sequences

abstractContent.text: We propose anew approach under the example-based machine translation paradigm.
First, the proposed approach retrieves the most similar example by carrying out DP-matching of the input sentence and example sentences while measuring the semantic distance of the words.
Second, the approach adjusts the gap between the input and the most similar example by using a bilingual dictionary.
We show the results of a computational experiment.

introductionContent.text: Knowledge acquisition from corpora is viable for machine translation.
The background is as follows: l Demands have been increasing for machine translation systems to handle a wider range of languages and domains.
l MT requires bulk knowledge consisting of rules and dictionaries.
l Building knowledge consumes considerable time and money.
l Bilingual/multilingual translations have become widely available.

datasetContent.text: To see whether this rough approach works or not, we conducted a computational experiment using a largescale bilingual corpus.
In this section, we show the experimental conditions, performance, and error analysis.
